requirement_tested: A homepage displaying an overview of house cleaning services with azure mist background and dark slate blue components
user_persona: A new visitor interested in exploring cleaning services offered by the company.
user_goal: To quickly understand what services are available and navigate to more details.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah visits the website for the first time and lands on the homepage. She immediately notices the professional look with a calming azure mist background and well-organized dark slate blue components.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Homepage loads successfully with hero section headline 'Professional House Cleaning Services', three service preview cards, and consistent color scheme applied.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Service Previews
narrative_steps.description: Sarah sees the three-column service preview cards and hovers her mouse over one to see if there's any interactive feedback.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a service card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The hovered service card elevates slightly with a shadow effect, providing visual feedback.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Service Details
narrative_steps.description: Intrigued by one of the services, Sarah clicks on its card to learn more about it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a service card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is navigated to the detailed service page for the selected cleaning service.

requirement_tested: A service browsing page listing all available cleaning services with detailed descriptions
user_persona: A homeowner looking for specific types of cleaning services for their home.
user_goal: To find and explore all available cleaning services and filter them by category.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Service Listings
narrative_steps.description: Mark navigates to the services page to see all available cleaning options.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the service browsing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page displays a grid layout of service cards with images, titles, descriptions, duration, and starting prices, along with a filter sidebar.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Services
narrative_steps.description: Mark wants to narrow down his options and decides to filter services by 'Deep Cleaning'.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Deep Cleaning' category filter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The displayed services dynamically update to show only those categorized as Deep Cleaning.

narrative_steps.title: Learning More About a Service
narrative_steps.description: Seeing a service he's interested in, Mark clicks the 'Learn More' button to get detailed information.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Learn More' button on a service card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Either the card expands to show full service details or the user is taken to a dedicated service page with comprehensive information.

requirement_tested: A service inquiry form allowing users to ask questions about specific cleaning services
user_persona: A potential customer with specific questions about a cleaning service package.
user_goal: To submit an inquiry about a particular cleaning service and receive confirmation.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Inquiry
narrative_steps.description: Lisa has questions about the regular cleaning service and goes to the inquiry page.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the service inquiry page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page loads with headline 'Have Questions About Our Services?' and a form containing fields for Name, Email, Service Selection, Subject, and Message.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Inquiry Form
narrative_steps.description: Lisa fills out the form but makes a mistake in her email format. She notices immediate validation feedback.
narrative_steps.action: Enter invalid email format in the email field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The email field is highlighted in red with an error message indicating invalid format.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Valid Inquiry
narrative_steps.description: After correcting her email, Lisa completes all required fields and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill all required fields correctly and click the Submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form data is validated, sent to backend, and a success message 'Your inquiry has been submitted! We will contact you shortly.' is displayed. The form is reset.

requirement_tested: A booking system enabling users to schedule cleaning services by selecting date, time, and service type
user_persona: A busy professional wanting to book a cleaning service online.
user_goal: To easily schedule a cleaning service at a convenient date and time.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Booking Process
narrative_steps.description: John decides to book a deep cleaning service and starts the booking process.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the booking page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Multi-step booking form appears with progress indicator, starting with service selection.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Date and Time
narrative_steps.description: John selects a date for the service and waits for available time slots to load.
narrative_steps.action: Select a date from the calendar widget.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Available time slots for the selected date and service are fetched and displayed in a grid.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Booking
narrative_steps.description: John picks a time slot, fills in his contact information, reviews the summary, and submits the booking.
narrative_steps.action: Select a time slot, fill contact details, and click the final Submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Booking is created successfully, and John receives a confirmation with booking details.

requirement_tested: A user dashboard for checking the status of booked cleaning services
user_persona: A returning customer who wants to track their upcoming cleaning appointments.
user_goal: To view the status of previously booked cleaning services.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Emily logs into her account to check the status of her upcoming cleaning appointment.
narrative_steps.action: Log in and navigate to the user dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard loads showing a list of Emily's bookings with service names, dates/times, status badges, and 'View Details' buttons.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Booking Details
narrative_steps.description: Emily wants more information about one of her bookings and clicks to view details.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'View Details' button for a booking.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal opens displaying specific booking details including service information, assigned cleaner (if available), and status timeline.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Status Updates
narrative_steps.description: Emily keeps the dashboard open to see if there are any real-time updates to her booking status.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for automatic dashboard refresh.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard automatically polls for updates every 30 seconds, and any status changes are reflected immediately in the UI.

requirement_tested: A contact us page with phone number and email address for reaching customer service staff
user_persona: A customer needing immediate assistance with a booking issue.
user_goal: To quickly get in touch with customer service via phone or email.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Contact Page
narrative_steps.description: Robert encounters a problem with his booking and goes to the contact page to reach customer service.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Contact Us page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page loads with contact information displayed in left column and an interactive map in the right column, all styled with the site's color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Calling Customer Service
narrative_steps.description: Robert prefers to speak directly with someone and decides to call the provided phone number.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the displayed phone number.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: On mobile devices, the click initiates a phone call. On desktop, the number is clearly displayed for manual dialing.

narrative_steps.title: Sending Email Inquiry
narrative_steps.description: Instead of calling, Robert decides to send an email inquiry by clicking the email link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the displayed email address.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Default mail client opens with the recipient field pre-filled with the customer service email address.

requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A user browsing the website on a slower network connection.
user_goal: To access service information without experiencing broken content or missing data.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dynamic Content
narrative_steps.description: Patricia visits the homepage and waits for the service information to load.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage and observe dynamic content loading.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Loading spinners appear during data fetch, and service information is displayed once the API response is received.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Network Errors
narrative_steps.description: While browsing services, Patricia experiences a temporary network issue.
narrative_steps.action: Simulate network failure when loading service data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User-friendly error message is displayed with a retry button. Failed image loads show fallback placeholders.

narrative_steps.title: Successfully Retrieving Data
narrative_steps.description: After resolving the network issue, Patricia tries again to load the service information.
narrative_steps.action: Click retry button or wait for automatic reload.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Components successfully fetch data from backend APIs and display the correct service information.

requirement_tested: Backend API server connecting to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables
user_persona: A developer deploying the application for the first time.
user_goal: To ensure the backend server starts correctly and connects to the database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: The developer sets up the environment variables and starts the backend server for the first time.
narrative_steps.action: Set environment variables and run backend server startup command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server initializes database connection pool using provided environment variables and starts listening on port 3001. Successful startup is logged.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: The developer wants to verify that the database connection is working properly.
narrative_steps.action: Make a simple API request that requires database access.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Request is processed successfully with data retrieved from PostgreSQL database. Database connection is acquired from pool for the query.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Configuration
narrative_steps.description: The developer checks that all database credentials are correctly used from environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Check server logs and database connection parameters.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Logs confirm that database connection is established using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

requirement_tested: Database schema supporting service listings, bookings, user inquiries, and service statuses
user_persona: A database administrator setting up the application database.
user_goal: To ensure the database schema is properly initialized with all required tables and relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Initializing Database Schema
narrative_steps.description: The DBA runs the application for the first time to set up the database schema.
narrative_steps.action: Start the application and trigger database initialization.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: SQL migration scripts execute successfully, creating services, bookings, inquiries, and users tables with proper constraints, indexes, and foreign key relationships.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Table Structure
narrative_steps.description: The DBA inspects the created tables to ensure they match the specification.
narrative_steps.action: Query database to inspect table schemas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables exist with correct columns: services (id, name, description, etc.), bookings (id, user_id, service_id, status, etc.), inquiries (id, name, email, etc.), users (id, name, email, etc.).

narrative_steps.title: Testing Data Operations
narrative_steps.description: The DBA performs basic data operations to verify functionality.
narrative_steps.action: Perform INSERT, UPDATE, and SELECT operations on the tables.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New records are inserted successfully, booking statuses can be updated, and related data can be retrieved using JOINs between tables.

requirement_tested: RESTful API endpoints for retrieving service information, submitting bookings, and checking service status
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating with the backend API.
user_goal: To successfully retrieve service data and submit new bookings through API endpoints.

narrative_steps.title: Retrieving Service Information
narrative_steps.description: The developer tests the GET endpoint to retrieve available services.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/services endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Endpoint returns a JSON array of active service objects with name, description, and pricing details.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting a New Booking
narrative_steps.description: The developer tests the POST endpoint to submit a new booking.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to /api/bookings with valid booking data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Endpoint validates request parameters, creates a new booking in the database, and returns a JSON confirmation with booking ID.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Authentication
narrative_steps.description: The developer tests accessing protected endpoints that require authentication.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/bookings without authentication, then with valid JWT token.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: First request returns 401 Unauthorized. Second request with valid token returns the authenticated user's bookings.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design compatible with desktop and mobile browsing
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the website on their smartphone.
user_goal: To navigate and use the website effectively on a small screen device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Website on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: David opens the website on his smartphone to book a cleaning service.
narrative_steps.action: Load website on a mobile device or simulate mobile viewport.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Website layout adjusts fluidly to mobile view with appropriate font sizing, spacing, and a hamburger menu for navigation.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Touch Elements
narrative_steps.description: David needs to click on various buttons and links throughout the booking process.
narrative_steps.action: Tap on interactive elements like buttons and links.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive elements are appropriately sized (minimum 44px x 44px) for easy finger tapping, with tap highlights replacing hover effects.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Viewport
narrative_steps.description: David rotates his device to landscape mode to see how the layout responds.
narrative_steps.action: Rotate device or resize browser window.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts smoothly between mobile portrait, mobile landscape, tablet, and desktop views with appropriate content reflow and navigation transformations.

requirement_tested: Contact form submission functionality with validation and confirmation
user_persona: A visitor trying to send a message through the contact form.
user_goal: To successfully submit a contact form and receive confirmation of receipt.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Contact Form
narrative_steps.description: Susan wants to inquire about services and fills out the contact form.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to contact page and fill out name, email, subject, and message fields.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Real-time client-side validation provides visual feedback as Susan types, with green checkmarks for valid fields and red highlights for invalid ones.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Valid Form
narrative_steps.description: After ensuring all fields are correctly filled, Susan submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Submit button with all valid data.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form data is sent to backend API where it's validated again, stored in the database, and a confirmation email is sent to Susan. Thank-you message is displayed.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Form Errors
narrative_steps.description: If Susan had initially submitted with errors, she would need to correct them.
narrative_steps.action: Submit form with invalid data and then correct errors.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Specific error messages are shown for invalid fields. Valid data remains in the form during correction, and resubmission is allowed after corrections.

requirement_tested: Service status tracking system showing real-time updates to customers
user_persona: A customer waiting for updates on their cleaning service status.
user_goal: To receive immediate notifications when their service status changes.

narrative_steps.title: Connecting to Real-Time Updates
narrative_steps.description: Michael logs into his dashboard to monitor his booking status and expects real-time updates.
narrative_steps.action: Log in and load the user dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: WebSocket connection is established, and dashboard shows live status indicators with visual timeline and notification badges.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Status Update
narrative_steps.description: While Michael is viewing his dashboard, his cleaning service status changes from 'confirmed' to 'in progress'.
narrative_steps.action: Simulate a status change event on the backend.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Real-time update is received via WebSocket, triggering UI refresh showing new status. Notification badge increments and timeline updates automatically.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Connection Issues
narrative_steps.description: Michael's internet connection drops temporarily while monitoring his service.
narrative_steps.action: Simulate WebSocket disconnection.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Warning icon appears indicating lost connection. System falls back to manual refresh or periodic polling, with automatic reconnection attempts.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'install:all' script to install both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new developer joining the project team.
user_goal: To set up the complete development environment with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Cloning Repository
narrative_steps.description: The new developer clones the project repository to their local machine.
narrative_steps.action: Clone the git repository.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Repository is cloned successfully with frontend and backend directories present.

narrative_steps.title: Installing All Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: The developer runs the installation script to set up all project dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Command executes npm install in both frontend and backend directories sequentially, installing all required dependencies for full stack development.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Installation
narrative_steps.description: The developer checks that all dependencies were installed correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Check node_modules folders in both frontend and backend directories.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend node_modules directories contain all necessary packages as defined in their respective package.json files.

requirement_tested: Package.json configured with 'dev' script to start both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer ready to begin coding and testing changes.
user_goal: To start both development servers simultaneously for efficient development workflow.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: The developer wants to start both frontend and backend servers for development.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run dev' from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently package starts both frontend development server (typically on port 3000) and backend server (on port 3001) simultaneously with combined terminal output.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Server Operation
narrative_steps.description: The developer checks that both servers are running correctly.
narrative_steps.action: Access frontend and backend endpoints in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend application loads at localhost:3000 and can communicate with backend API at localhost:3001. Both processes show active file watching for hot reloading.

narrative_steps.title: Stopping Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: After finishing work, the developer stops both servers cleanly.
narrative_steps.action: Press Ctrl+C in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend processes shut down gracefully with cleanup operations executed for open connections and temporary files. Proper exit codes are reported.
